summary: The Universal Savings Account Act of 2025 proposes to amend the Internal Revenue Code to create Universal Savings Accounts (USAs). These accounts, exempt from taxation, are designed for the exclusive benefit of individuals and are subject to contribution limits. The bill details requirements for account establishment, treatment of contributions and distributions, qualified rollovers, handling upon death, and reporting. It addresses excess contribution taxes, prohibited transactions, and failure to provide reports related to these accounts. The amendments are effective for taxable years beginning after December 31, 2024.
